attributes.action: Bar Entry of Robert Spencer and all circulation of his material into the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Robert Spencer born in 1962, is an author and the director of the controversial Jihad Watch and Dhimmi Watch websites.

His books are what can be conceived as inflammatory and his rhetoric questionable.

He is a keen supporter of Geert Wilders and publicly without remorse shows Wilder's film "Fitna" and also has done an interview with Wilders which has posted on YouTube.

He has also gone onto criticise UK government policy and laws in a means to justify his position.

He is in clear breach of:
Racial and Religious Hatred Act 2006
29A Meaning of “religious hatred”
29B Use of words or behaviour or display of written material
29C Publishing or distributing written material
29E Distributing, showing or playing a recording
29F Broadcasting or including programme in programme service
and 29G Possession of inflammatory material

He is therefore a threat to national security and the British People, as his material is being used as fuel and or ammunition by extremist elements and fascist groups.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
